intro: Bonnetia colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian bonnetia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, often growing in shrub form. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface, while its flowers range in color from white to pale yellow. Bonnetia colombiana is adapted to high-altitude environments and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
